Operation 'travelimpactmodel.flights.computeFlightEmissions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary was missing entirely. Description, while comprehensive, was difficult for AI agents to parse due to poor structure and unclear input/output expectations. Improved summary provides clear action-oriented statement. Reorganized description to lead with the primary action, clarify input constraints (up to 1000 flights), explain output behavior (same order, empty fields for unavailable estimates), and list failure conditions more clearly. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description: Stateless method to retrieve emission estimates. Details on how emission estimates are computed: https://github.com/google/travel-impact-model The response will contain all entries that match the input flight legs, in the same order. If there are no estimates available for a certain flight leg, the response will return the flight leg object with empty emission fields. The request will still be considered successful. Reasons for missing emission estimates include: * The flight is unknown to the server. * The input flight leg is missing one or more identifiers. * The flight date is in the past. * The aircraft type is not supported by the model. * Missing seat configuration. The request can contain up to 1000 flight legs. If the request has more than 1000 direct flights, if will fail with an INVALID_ARGUMENT error.
data.summary_suggestion: Compute carbon emission estimates for flights
data.description_suggestion: Computes carbon emission estimates for one or more direct flight legs. Accepts a batch of up to 1000 flight requests and returns emission estimates for each flight in the same order. For flights where emission estimates cannot be computed (e.g., unknown aircraft, missing identifiers, past dates, unsupported aircraft types, or missing seat configuration), the response returns the flight object with empty emission fields. The request is considered successful even if some flights lack estimates. This is a stateless operation. See https://github.com/google/travel-impact-model for model computation details.
data.reasoning: Original summary was missing entirely. Description, while comprehensive, was difficult for AI agents to parse due to poor structure and unclear input/output expectations. Improved summary provides clear action-oriented statement. Reorganized description to lead with the primary action, clarify input constraints (up to 1000 flights), explain output behavior (same order, empty fields for unavailable estimates), and list failure conditions more clearly. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.
